Operations do not encroach on ecosystems or communities

To reach a sustainable future, every company must preserve the health of areas of high biological, ecological, social or cultural value - both by protecting such areas where the company already operates, and avoiding further degradation when moving into new areas.

This includes, but is not limited to: respecting the land rights of communities (e.g. no land grabbing); protecting aquatic ecosystems from degradation (e.g. avoiding coral reefs); protecting areas of high biodiversity value (e.g. no clearing of rainforest); and not encroaching on areas of cultural importance (e.g. avoiding regions considered sacred by Indigenous Peoples).
